div.font: Schools are closed for the rest of the school year. Will life ever return to normal?
What is normal? Now is the time to create the new normal. In the meantime:

font.font: Wash your hands. Read, read, read. Post a YouTube video.
font.span: Pick up your room. Pick up the house. Pickup the yard. Wash the windows, inside and out. Pet the cat. Have a serious discussion with the dog, about your new life. Wave to everyone that goes past your house.

span.font: There really is a lot to do.

div.font: For fishing season this year, the Onalaska High School Aquaculture Program will plant its very own homegrown Rainbow Trout Broodstock. We plan on releasing 70, 10lb and 300, 3.5lb Rainbow Trout the day before fishing season opens into Carlisle Lake. These fish have been raised by the Aquaculture students over the past 4 years.
The Aquaculture program is made possible by a generous grant given by TransAlta, continual support from the Chehalis Basin Fisheries Task Force, Weyerhaeuser, Bio-Oregon, and several others.
Please share with everyone you know so these fish will be caught before summer hits!

span.font: Don't miss out on our historical 2020 Onalaska High School Yearbook! Only a limited supply left as this edition will be one of a kind. Includes Fall and Winter Sports, Activities, Students, current events that impacted OHS, and much much more!

div.font: You may either mail in your $45 payment to: Onalaska High School Yearbook, 540 Carlisle Avenue, Onalaska, WA 98570 with Josten's order form, or purchase online at the following link: http://jostensyearbooks.com/?REF=A09055000. Deadline is 6/1/2020.

b.span: In Honor of Our Logger Seniors

div.span: 8:20 (20:20) all high schools in Washington State are going to turn on their stadium lights to honor this year's Class of 2020. Onalaska Memorial Field lights will be shining bright...

font.font: Please respect the social distancing policy and, of course, be safe.

h3.font: The free meals being delivered to Ony students, do not make and deliver themselves. There is a dedicated crew behind the making and delivering of meals. The prep crew begins their day at 6:00 am.
Volunteers are working through spring break, many without pay, to make and deliver meals.

div.font: We appreciate and value these dedicated employees. Thank you.

img.font: Free Meals for kids can be delivered to Onalaska children while school is out. Please fill out the survey if you want free meals delivered Monday - Friday. Free Meals for Kids Request Form

h3.font: Meals are for children under 19. Children's faces must be seen for each meal served. They can come out to get the meals from the Ony Transportation Staff or the can stand in the window so they can be seen while one person comes out for the meals.
To start receiving meals please fill out the Free Meals for Kids Request Form.
If you need to make changes email jcarlson@onysd.wednet.edu with School Meals in the Subject line.

i.a: Free Meals for Kids Request Form

font.font: Have You Taken a Walk Yet?

div.span: Take a walk, everyday. Walk around your yard and then go down your driveway, the dog will love you.
Parents and Guardians of Onalaska Students:
div.div: We just surpassed our first month being out of school. I am sure you are like us and wish our kids were back in school. Believe me, we do miss them everyday. This continues to be challenging times for all of us, including you who are at home all day with your children.

We did issue over 100 Chromebooks yesterday and today, so we are hoping that communication with students and staff will be improved as well as the ability for your child to access information and do their assigned work.

Speaking of assigned work, teachers have been back this week working on another set of learning packets. Building principals should be contacting you about the process of turning in completed work and issuing new work. We have worked on establishing how much work and contact teachers should be having with your child. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me or the building principal and we will do our best to answer the questions.

We continue to deliver breakfast and lunch each day. We are now delivering over 840 meals daily, driving about 200 total miles, using our vans and vehicles. As we get closer to summer, there will be some changes in the delivery of food. Mr. Carlson and Mrs. Carpenter will meet with me to discuss the process of providing food to your children. I will get that information out to you as soon as we put together our plan.
There will be no summer school at this point in time. However, we will be serving meals during those three weeks in July that normally would have been our summer school session.

Tomorrow evening (Friday) at 8:20pm, we will be turning on our high school field lights to honor our seniors. They will be on for 20 minutes to recognize the Class of 2020, who most likely have missed out the most of all our students. There was no Prom, no Scholarship Night, no end of the year awards recognition, and most likely no Graduation as we know it. We are working on a plan for Graduation and will pass this on in the near future. If you participate tomorrow at 8;20pm, we ask you enter the high school on the south entrance next to the park. Stay in your vehicles at all times. Drive around to the back of the school and then exit going past the bus barn and tennis courts. We do anticipate a good turnout, so be patient.

Please let me know if you have questions about our schools and let me know how things are going. I am not a "facebooker", but others have shared with me very funny stories, pictures, as well as frustrations that we are all experiencing. Some of it is very creative. Hang in there, do the best you can under these trying circumstances and continue to practice good hygiene and safety procedures. What we all are doing is working, but we still have a long way to go to eradicate this virus. It will take time.
Have a great weekend and enjoy this great weather.

hr.div: To assist in the effort to continue student instruction and promote staff continuing ed, we will enable the guest network, for all to use.

div.span: Starting Monday, March 23, 2020, the Onalaska School District will make the Guest WiFi network available 24/7. To access the Guest network, you may park in the elementary parking lot. There is no password, but there is a click-through page you must acknowledge via your browser.

font.font: Onalaska First in State to Deliver Meals.

div.span: The Onalaska Food Service and Transportation department workers have pulled off an amazing accomplishment. They have shifted meal service from "onsite" to "delivered" in a short, wild weekend. This is impressive, to say the least.

span.font: The Onalaska Food Service department is the first School Food Service department in the state to deliver
meals to families as a result of the CoronaVirus quarantine. Food Service Director, Jerry Carlson,

applied Friday and was approved by OSPI Monday. The Onalaska School Cooks & Transportation Staff delivered 209 meals to kids on Tues, 324 on Weds & 373 went out Thursday. Chicken Nuggets, Coleslaw, Fresh Fruit, St. Patrick's Cake & Milk was the first meal to go out. Other meals were chicken salad wrap, taco salads & homemade pizza tomorrow.
This is a Federal program to help families & the local economy while school is out.

font.br: The dedication and commitment of Onalaska Food Service, Transportation and District Office employees (actually ALL of Onalaska employees) is truly remarkable.

span.font: Here's a big "Hip-Hip-Horray!" and "Thank You" to the folks who are making this great achievement happen quickly and smoothly.
